best_practices: Keep state as close to where it is used as possible
Separate server state (React Query) from client state (Zustand/Redux)
Use selectors to prevent unnecessary re-renders
anti_patterns: Putting everything in global state when local state would suffice
Duplicating server state instead of letting React Query manage it
Mutating state directly instead of using immutable updates

faq.question: What is the difference between Zustand and Redux Toolkit?
faq.answer: Zustand is minimal and simpler with less boilerplate. Redux Toolkit provides more structure with built-in patterns for complex apps.

faq.question: When should I use React Query over global state?
faq.answer: Use React Query for server data that comes from APIs. Use global state for UI state that lives only in the browser.

faq.question: Can I combine multiple state solutions?
faq.answer: Yes, common pattern is React Query for server state plus Zustand or Jotai for client UI state.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my project files?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance and code examples. You implement changes manually in your codebase.

faq.question: Why use Jotai over other solutions?
faq.answer: Jotai excels when you need atomic updates and fine-grained reactivity without re-rendering parent components.

faq.question: How do I debug state changes?
faq.answer: Redux DevTools and Zustand devtools middleware provide time-travel debugging for state changes.
